Experience Medical Billing Specialist The NM Family Connection, LLC May 2015  – Present (4 months) RHIT Exam Prep Instructor ITT Technical Institute May 2013  – Present (2 years 4 months) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Develop and implemented a structured class for candidates who are preparing to test for their RHIT credential. 
Professionals holding the RHIT credential are health information technicians who: 
•Ensure the quality of medical records by verifying their completeness, accuracy, and proper entry into computer systems. 
•Use computer applications to assemble and analyze patient data for the purpose of improving patient care or controlling costs. 
•Often specialize in coding diagnoses and procedures in patient records for reimbursement and research. An additional role for RHITs is cancer registrars - compiling and maintaining data on cancer patients. Medical Coder UNM Hospitals February 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years 4 months) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Code inpatient hospital discharge and outpatient day surgery records for the purpose of reimbursement, research and compliance with federal regulation according to diagnosis, operation, and procedure using ICD-9-CM classification system. Ensures adherence to Hospital and Departmental Policies and Procedures. Trained for the upcoming ICD-10 implementation. Health Information Technician UNM Sandoval Regional Medical Center August 2012  –  February 2013  (7 months) Prepare documentations for addition into the electronic medical records, scan with quality checks. Perform Patient record quality checks and conducted release of information all in accordance with HIPPA requirements. Registrar @ Colinas del Norte Elementary School Rio Rancho Public Schools July 2006  –  August 2012  (6 years 2 months) Responsible for registration and withdrawing student and the integrity of students personal information; data entry for the purpose of state reporting; report generation and schedule creation. Electronically create the student records, which includes scheduling and attendance in the district software, PowerSchool. General office skills; telephone management, scheduling meetings, greeting and addressing parental concerns. Program Manager, Assembly Test Manufacturing Intel Corporation April 2004  –  February 2006  (1 year 11 months) Project manager for the People systems team responsible for providing integrated solutions that enable F7 Test multi cultural employees quickly and smoothly to contribute to a successful startup and ramp. Solutions included staffing, relocation, instruction of best know methods, manufacturing training systems TED’s, TX, Peer training, and curriculums. Created a SharePoint based best known method system to share with the ATM VF Organizations. Responsible for creating desktop procedures and business processes for the virtual factories. Facilitator for the Training systems group, responsible for implementing training systems and programs and success indicators for the organization. Coached, trained and mentored several team members to a superuser for all software systems. Summary I have excelled at Intel Corporation for over 6 years in both the Oregon and Arizona in several different capacities that include IT, Manufacturing, and Talent Acquisition. In my current role I am the Technical Training Leader for photolithography and suppor Intel's military talent acquisition program. In my current role I am the Technical Training Leader for photolithography and suppor Intel's military talent acquisition program. Experience Workforce Capability Program Manager Intel Corporation August 2015  – Present (1 month) Operational excellence led by capable, inspired, professional and empowered Manufacturing Specialists & Technicians Technical Training Program Manager Intel Corporation September 2012  –  August 2015  (3 years) I support over 800 Engineers and Technicians across all manufacturing processes as a Technical Training Program Manager in Intel's Arizona manufacturing organization, the leading high-volume manufacturer of the company's core product lines. Our department provides world class support to the manufacturing operations at two semiconductor fabrication plants collocated on the Ocotillo campus. My role requires systems support of internal certification and training applications along with departmental productivity improvement initiatives. 
 
The results of my efforts have led to the proliferation of the first Intel approved secure video capture of the semiconductor manufacturing process, the implementation of a new knowledge transfer repository for the dissemination of IP throughout the launch of a new technology, and the certification of over 300 Technicians on the skill sets of external Field Service Engineers. 
Other responsibilities include: 
 
- SharePoint administration 
- LMS (Learning Management System) administration 
- Coordination of external vendor training 
- Military Veteran Staffing and Recruiting Company Commander Oregon Army National Guard July 2014  –  July 2015  (1 year 1 month) HHD 249th RTI - Oversee the training and readiness for 78 assigned Soldiers of the 249th Regional Training Institute 
- Advise the Regimental Commander on personnel readiness for the Headquarters Detachment. 
- RTI Safety Officer responsible for the ground and vehicle safety programs 
- Account for over $20 million of equipment in 3 geographical locations across the state 
 
Previous positions in the Army 
 
Oregon Army National Guard: 
 
April 2011 – July 2014 
Threat Assessment Officer 
Advised the Detachment Commander on defensive measures against CBRNE attacks to minimize damage to installations and MSRs during Operation Tiger Balm and NTC rotation 14-8. Assisted with the coordination of Area Damage Control, Movement Control, Terrain Management, and Operational Protection functions of the Rear Area during exercises. Planned and recommended Protection Cell training activities.  
Developed CBRNE operations overview training and compiled the objectives and roles of the TSD in the NTC rotation 14-08 in preparation for rotation 15-08 with 7th ID. 
Advised the 158th MEB Commander on CBRNE defense, reconnaissance, and MTOE capabilities while training for Operation Pegasus Fury with the AZ ARNG. 
 
May 2008 – August 2010 
Platoon Leader 
* Commanded 60+ convoy escort missions tasked with the protection of commodities, personnel, and equipment delivered throughout the Iraqi theater of operations. 
* Responsible for the welfare, morale, and training of 52 soldiers assigned to my command. 
* Personally accountable for the maintenance, operation, and serviceability of over $8 million in vehicles, equipment, and weapons systems. 
 
August 2006 – May 2008 
Legal Specialist 
 
June 2004 - August 2006 
Financial Specialist 
 
United States Army: 
 
Training and Records Supervisor 
August 2001 – June 2004 
 IT Training Forecast Manager Intel Corporation January 2009  –  September 2012  (3 years 9 months) Provided direct support to Intel's IT department ranging from continuous tactical engagement with the global help desk to catalog and content management of the internal learning content management system (LCMS). From 2009 to 2012 I engaged in, and led multiple projects impacting the training delivery for over 6,500 IT employees while directing the strategic direction of the $2M central training budget.

Industrial Productivity Engineering GL Intel, Costa Rica March 2008  –  May 2009  (1 year 3 months) Time in role; Company phone number: (506) 22 98 60 00 
Scope and achievements 
Responsible for leading the organization to establish productivity improvement in safety, quality, 
layout and headcount. Developed metrics to measure equipment and factory capacity and output, 
and identifying equipment and process flow bottlenecks. Developed solutions to problems utilizing 
formal education and judgment. Responsible for the monitoring and maintenance of product 
health indicators (PHI's) and accurately reflecting these in the capacity models as part of 
maintenance of business. CR IDM Mngr Componentes Intel de Costa Rica January 2006  –  March 2008  (2 years 3 months) Indirect Materials Purchasing Manager in charge of management of 500+ suppliers (local and international) and 10k+ parts to purchase. Supervising 12 people (exempts and non-exempts) whose primary role was making sure supplies were on site when needed on the quantity and quality needed for all machines and handling media for both manufacturing facilities in CR: desktop processors and chipsets. Secondly, Supplier Development in the local market (within Costa Rica and the Central American region) was key for cost effective business management. Experience Training Manager Intel Corporation January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Folsom, California I currently manage the Learning and Development team for the Software and Services Group at Intel Corporation. We deliver learning solutions focused on technical training, technical leadership development, as well as manager and leadership development to over 5,000 globally dispersed software engineers. Technical Training Program Manager Intel Corporation June 2012  –  December 2013  (1 year 7 months) Folsom, California Responsible for developing and executing technical training and technical leadership development strategy for over 5,000 globally-dispersed software engineers at Intel Corporation. 
 
In this role, I partnered with key stakeholders from various divisions to implement a blended learning approach with instructor-led and virtual training by internal subject matter experts, as well as external training vendors. In addition, I incorporated technical summits, web-based solutions and social learning solutions such as podcasts and blogging. Learning Technologist - Visual & Parallel Computing Group Intel Corporation September 2008  –  May 2012  (3 years 9 months) Folsom, California Responsible for Technical Training, Technical Leadership Development and Technical Events for 3,500 globally dispersed team of visual & parallel computing engineers.
